Entries.default: "Come to seek ablutions for your sins?" He slaps his knee with a bark of laughter.
"Back to ease your weary bones, eh?"
"Massage? Bath? Whatever you need, just ask."
"How much for your time?"
"How'd you end up here?"
"Never mind."
"Oh, you don't want to hear about that. Lived a boring life, so there wouldn't be much to the telling." He crosses his thick arms over his chest. A slight blush spreads across his cheeks.
"Two hundred fifty copper - soaps, oils, and fresh linens all included." He waggles his eyebrows at you and grins.
"That's a reasonable price."

"Disrobe over here, then hop in the bath. You'll have a nice long soak while I wash your hair."

He hands you a fluffy towel and turns away while you change out of your clothes.

"Truth be told, my real passion is pottery. Trouble is, I got these big hands. Not meant for delicate work."

He turns his hands palm up for you to inspect. Just one is easily large enough to cover your entire face.
"Indulge me."
"Fair enough."

A burly dwarven man hums a jaunty tune to himself as he fastidiously organizes his collection of scented oils.

When he hears you enter the room, he greets you with a smile and a humongous outstretched hand. His grip is strong and sure.
"Worked out in the end, of course. Now I specialize in relieving tension in aumaua and death godlike." He nods to himself.
"Get it? Ablutions? Absolution? Ah, I crack myself up. Gets me every time." He wipes a tear from his eye, still chuckling.
"Best massage in Neketaka! That's what they tell me, anyway."
"You seem bored here."
"Do you like your work?"
"I had other questions."
[Leave] "Farewell."
"Be seeing you." He frowns slightly, then shrugs and turns a sunny grin on you.
"I guess I can't hide my feelings as well as I thought I could." He gives you a nervous chuckle and scratches at his beard.
"The stability's good and all, but I haven't seen anything that gets my blood pumping in ages. You know what I mean?"
"Stability sounds pretty good right about now."
"What's life without a little excitement?"
"You don't know how good you have it."
"Eh, the pay's good and my clients are interesting enough." He shrugs noncommittally.
"Not exactly a ringing endorsement."
"You could always quit."
[Leave.] "I should be going."
"You caught me there." He gives you an awkward chuckle and scratches at his beard.
"I can't pretend to know your troubles. But if you ever want to talk about them, I'm here to listen. For a price, of course."
"Naturally."
"Doing the same old thing, day in, day out - it's enough to make a man leap from the nearest window." He nods vigorously.
"You could come with me."

"Where to?" He raises an inquisitive brow.

His large hands, previously dancing with restless energy, still.
"You know that seven hundred foot tall statue made of adra? I'm going after it."
[Leave.] "Well, I should be off."
"Nothing's free, friend, and certianly not time - not when I could be doing other things with mine." He winks exaggeratedly, then grimaces.
"True enough. Not everybody's got a room of their own and a plump feather bed, eh?"
"I should go - got a busy day of adventuring ahead of me."
"Where are you headed?"
[Leave.] "No time to explain, I'm afraid."
"I need the work. Someone has to send money home to pa, and my lazy lump of a sister isn't about to do it."
"I know a thing or two about collecting coin - you could come with me."
"Hel, most night I don't even have half that."
"No kidding?" He nearly drops a bottle of massage oil in his excitement.
"Sounds like a good story. Care to share it?"
"Hel and a half, think I might have pulled something in my face."
"You ever need a hand, don't forget about ol' Konstanten. I'll just... be right here. Waiting." His eyes drift to the floor.
"I'd like to see something like that for myself." He sighs, a wistful edge in his voice.
[Recruit Konstanten.] "Grab your things, then, and let's go."
[Leave.] "Maybe another time."
"Hel, you don't have to tell me twice!"
"You need to work out your kinks, you find me in my room, eh?"
"Feeling better, right? Heh."

"I will observe his technique... captain." 

TekÄ“hu clears his throat.
"Hey, you're not the only one carrying some extra tension around."
"What's the price for two?" She clears her throat pointedly.
"Do you do anything... else?"
"I see."
"Eh? Oh! Hah, no. These old bones - you know how it is. Wouldn't want to hurt myself."
"Or you, for that matter."
"Where's my key gone?"
"Who's been touching my stuff?"
"Just a minute."
"Do you think I could come with you? Just for a bit?"
"Oh, you're back. Didn't think I'd be seeing you again."
"You give any more thought to what I said? About coming with you? I'll be quiet as a dormouse, won't take up any space."
"I'm glad to be, of course. Seeing you, I mean."
"Why should I bring you along?"
"No, and I don't plan to."
"Well, I can watch my own back in a fight. Yours, too."
"And you won't be eatin' hardtack when it's my turn to cook. Not unless there's nothing else. Or unless you want to. You know what I mean." He chuckles, one hand absently combing his beard.
"Well. Can't make it anymore clear than that, can you?" He sighs deeply and turns away.
"What can I do for you?" His voice is rough and flat, his eyes steely.
"Good luck with that."
As you turn to go, he grabs you by the arm.
"Wonder what Pa's up to."
"Let's get a move on."
"What are we standing around for?"
